inlineImageAndParagraph.heading: What is Phonetic Name Matching?
content: Decentro's Phonetic Name Matching API is a key component of our Data Forensics suite, designed to solve the complexity of identity verification in a multi-cultural, multi-lingual environment. Traditional string matching fails when faced with spelling variations, typos, or transliteration differences (e.g., 'Sara' vs. 'Sarah' or 'Kumar' vs. 'Cumar').

Our API utilizes advanced phonetic algorithms to analyze names based on how they sound rather than how they are spelled. This ensures accurate reconciliation of customer data across disparate sources, reduces false rejections during KYC onboarding, and significantly improves the pass rates of legitimate users while maintaining strict fraud prevention standards.

methodData.heading: How It Works
methodData.subHeading: From raw text to confidence score in milliseconds.

items.title: Input Normalization
items.description: The API accepts two name strings. It automatically strips honorifics and salutations (e.g., Mr., Dr., Mrs.) to isolate the core identity.

items.title: Phonetic Encoding
items.description: The names are processed through phonetic algorithms that convert text into acoustic codes, bypassing spelling differences.

items.title: Similarity Scoring
items.description: The system compares the codes and returns a similarity match percentage based on your configured threshold logic.

textAndButtonBannerTransparent2.subHeading: Designed for low-latency environments to ensure seamless user experiences.
